intro: Neuroloma pulvinatum, commonly known as the pulvinate neuroloma, is a rare and unusual plant species characterized by its unique floral structure. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is known for its aromatic properties. The plant features a distinctive pulvinate (swollen) base on its flowers, which is a rare morphological trait. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and ecologically significant species.
